clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of VEGF Polymorphism as Predictive Factor in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Treated With Folfiri Plus Bevacizumab
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of -1498 c/t VEGF Polymorphism in the Prediction of Benefit From First-line Folfiri Plus Bevacizumab in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: -1498C/T VEGF polymorphism, as suggested by a recent retrospective analysis, seems to have a role in predicting the efficacy of Bevacizumab plus FOLFIRI in first-line treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer patients. The present study aims to prospectively evaluate the predictive role of this polymorphism in metastatic colorectal patients receiving the same treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is defined as time from study entry until progression of disease (according to RECIST 1.1) or death from any cause. Patients who are alive without having progressed at the end of the study will be censored at their last radiological assessment

secondary_outcome.description: Response Rate (RR) is defined as the fraction of treated patients who achieve a response as defined according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
Overall survival (OS) is defined as the time from study entry until death from any cause. Patients who are alive at the end of the study will be censored at that point

study_pop.textblock: Metastatic colorectal cancer patients receiving FOLFIRI plu Bevacizumab as first-line treatment
